body_html: Thanks, Gunan - that makes no difference, unfortunately. Even with cuDNN 6, I am still getting the cuDNN cannot create handle error. Even setting the GPUptions directly doesn't prevent the error, although it does reduce the amount of GPU memory used. The GPU memory is taken up by Python, so if I shut this down, it closes my Jupyter notebook. I have been stuck on this for nearly 4 days now and seem to have exhausted all the suggestions I have seen online. Could this be a TF 1.3 issue?

body: Thanks, Gunan - that makes no difference, unfortunately. Even with cuDNN 6, I am still getting the cuDNN cannot create handle error. Even setting the GPUptions directly doesn't prevent the error, although it does reduce the amount of GPU memory used. The GPU memory is taken up by Python, so if I shut this down, it closes my Jupyter notebook. I have been stuck on this for nearly 4 days now and seem to have exhausted all the suggestions I have seen online. Could this be a TF 1.3 issue?
